author: Judith Aisthorpe
title: High chance of cyclone forming
text:
THERE is now a high chance of a cyclone forming in the Gulf of Carpentaria on Sunday according to the Bureau of Meteorology.
While the sun shone for most of Wednesday, the BOM is predicting Eastern costal areas of the NT can expect to see heavy showers or storms in the coming days as a tropical low develops.
Senior Forecaster Mark Kersemakers, said if the low forms into a tropical cyclone it will be called Alfred.
“The tropical low is expected to remain slow moving in the southern Gulf of Carpentaria over the next few days,” he said.
”The Bureau will be monitoring the tropical low around the clock, and will be providing ongoing updates.”
The cyclone is not expected to affect Darwin.
He said across the rest of the Top End and in Darwin, showers and storms will ease as we move into a monsoon break and back to more ‘typical’ wet season conditions of the chance of showers and storms on most days.
Keep up to date with the latest advice and warnings from BOM at www.bom.gov.aucyclone/, via Twitter updates (@BOM_NT) and fellow the advice from the NT Emergency Service at securent.nt.gov.au/
Originally published as High chance of cyclone forming
